clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-label Clinical Study of the Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Elsulfavirine, 200 mg Tablets, With Single and Multiple Oral Administration in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Clinical Study of the Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Elsulfavirine, 200 mg Tablets, With Single and Multiple Oral Administration in Healthy Volunteers.

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label clinical study of the pharmacokinetics and safety of Elsulfavirine, 200 mg tablets, with single and multiple oral administration in healthy volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock:
The present study is an open-label, single-center, clinical study of the pharmacokinetics and safety of Elsulfavirin 200 mg tablets in four dosage regimens:
- Cohort I (N = 3). Single oral dose of 400 mg.
- Cohort II (N = 3). Single oral dose of 800 mg.
- Cohort III (N = 3). Single oral administration at a dose of 1200 mg.
- Cohort IV (N = 6). A single 1200 mg oral dose followed by 200 mg daily for 9 days.
The study is descriptive and will not test any hypotheses. Based on previous studies and the intended descriptive objectives of the study, no control group is planned.
To ensure safety, the following scheme for using the investigational drug is provided:
- The inclusion in the study of volunteers included in each subsequent cohort will be carried out strictly after the completion of the study by the last study subject included in the previous cohort and obtaining a safety opinion.
- Dosing in the multiple administration cohort will be 2 + 4. Initially, 2 volunteers will be included, after completion of participation, 4 more volunteers will be dosed.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of Elsulfavirine, 200 mg tablets, in healthy volunteers. The incidence of AEs and SAEs.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cohort I-III Not more than 28 days. Cohort IV Not more than 39 days.
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of Elsulfavirine, 200 mg tablets, in healthy volunteers. Describe and study the pharmacokinetic parameters and relative bioavailability of the study drug for different modes of administration. Conduct an assessment and comparative analysis of the safety and tolerability of the study drug based on data on adverse events.

arm_group.description: Cohort I (N = 3). Single oral dose of 400 mg.
Cohort II (N = 3). Single oral dose of 800 mg.
Cohort III (N = 3). Single oral administration at a dose of 1200 mg.
Cohort IV (N = 6). A single 1200 mg oral dose followed by 200 mg daily for 9 days.
